item.title: Eri add a quote by Patrick H.T. Doyle
item.description: "Lions are born knowing they are predators. Antelopes understand they are the prey. Humans are one of the few creatures on Earth given the choice." -- Patrick H.T. Doyle

item.title: Eri add a quote by Patrick H.T. Doyle
item.description: "If Pavlov tested his cat he would have failed." -- Patrick H.T. Doyle

item.title: Eri add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Eri add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Eri add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Eri add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Eri add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Eri add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Eri add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Eri add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare oneâ€™s self to die." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Eri add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Reading maketh a full man; and writing an axact man. And, therefore, if a man write little, he need have a present wit; and if he read little, he need have much cunning to seem to know which he doth not." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Eri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho
